title: Access to Health Care: An Interdisciplinary Approach
driving_question: How can we improve access to health care in our local and global communities?
short_background_context: The College Board and WE organization have partnered to create a service-learning program that combines academic rigor with real-world issues. This mission focuses on the topic of access to health care, a critical issue that affects diverse populations across the globe. The College Board is a not-for-profit organization that promotes excellence and equity in education. WE is a movement that empowers people to change the world through a charitable foundation and a social enterprise. Together, they aim to develop well-rounded citizens who can apply their classroom knowledge to address relevant needs in their communities.
tasks: Research and analyze the current state of health care access in your local community. Identify key issues and potential solutions.
Use statistical methods to predict the impact of your proposed solutions on health care access over the next decade.
Develop a campaign to raise awareness about health care access issues and your proposed solutions. This could include a presentation, a website, or a community event.
pre_thinking_prompts: What do you already know about health care access in your community?
What questions do you have about health care access?
What factors do you think might influence health care access?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on what you have learned about health care access and your role as a citizen. How has this mission changed your understanding of these issues?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why health care access is an important issue?
How did you use statistical methods in your analysis?
What factors did you consider when developing your campaign?
remix_zone: Students could remix this problem by focusing on a different aspect of health care access, such as mental health services or health insurance coverage. They could also adapt the mission to focus on a different community or region.
